column4: I have ubuntu 10.04 on my Virtualbox and my OS is the same. I can't change the screen size of my virtual ubuntu!
I went to System >> Preferences >> Monitors
but the only option for resulotion is 800*600
you might need to install the vbox guest addations.. ie not messed with vb4 lately
but I think it does not work with v4?
What should I do? there is no way with this version?
i havent used vbox4 yet. so  im not sure what may be the issue. Other then installing the proper guest addations in the guest os..  not sure what else to try.
clarify what you mean. the term 'boot page' is a little vague
I'm talking about the page show during ubuntu boot up
you mean the ubuntu ....... loading screen?
if so thats 'plymouth' there are some plymouth themes.. i just disable plymouth. i find it pointless
I'm searching for plymouth themes. THNX and I'm sorry because of my english
theres a few in the default repos for  kubuntu and lubuntu i think. but as i said. i dont use them. i think they are pointless
I'm redistributing from ubuntu and I shoud change it
